statement.text: The P g value ranges from 2.52 to 6.14.
All the values in MAE and RMSE has negative values.
The ME , MAE and RMSE for the wet and dry season are presented in Table 4 and Table 5 respectively.
In the wet season ( Table 4 ), the ME shows differences in altitude of the in-situ observations for both products using both downscaling methods.
The ME of CHIRPS shows large overestimation at the lowland (Finarawa) with better BL downscaling values (closer to zero) than with NN.

caption.text: Daily correlation coefficients and distances between in-situ rainfall observations at UTB within 1 January 2015–31 December 2018, except Finarawa, end up in 31 December 2017. The numbers before parentheses denote correlation coefficients and the numbers in the parentheses denote distances between stations in kilometres.

caption.text: Contingency matrix to evaluate the frequency of rainfall detection of CHIRPS and MPEG at daily time interval.

statement.text: The In-situ measured rainfall is H for Satellite detected rainfall.
The No in-situ measured rainfall is FA for Satellite detected rainfall.
The are 3 types of rainfall measurement done in the given table.
The In-situ measured rainfall is H for No rainfall detected by satellite.
